p: Plaque assays: Vero cells (5×10 5 cells/well) were grown to a confluent monolayer in 6 well plates and infected with serial dilutions of ZIKV-infected culture supernatant. Incubation was carried out for 2 hours at 37°C with 5% CO 2, after which monolayers were rinsed with sterile phosphate buffered saline (PBS). Monolayers were overlaid with maintenance medium containing 0.6% molten agarose and incubated at 37°C with 5% CO 2 for 3 days. At the end of incubation period, secondary overlay media (primary overlay media along with 1% neutral red) was poured and incubated at 37°C overnight with 5% CO 2. The next day plaques were counted.
